name: Novelty
body:
#### Below you can find some info about the Indesign scripts in the Novelty repository.

### Align to Grid
Run this script to align the selected Rectangles or TextFrames to the Document Grid.

### Baseline Fitter
Sets baseline to fit page based on selected selected text leading.
With the ability to adjusts page margins, styles and grid accordingly.

### Change Case With Style
Easy change case of text, using regular expressions styles or both! You should thank Thomas Silkjær
for this one.

### Clear Paragraph Overrides
With this script you can choose to clear all paragraph overrides in the document, or only clear overrides of selected paragraph styles.

### Document Frames to Bleed
This script will expand or contract rectangles (picture frames) to the bleed of the parent page.
To fit the selected frame only see _Frame to Bleed_ below.

### Export Book
Exports all stories in an InDesign document or book. It will only run the book script if no InDesign documents are open. This script is based on the awesome ExportAllText.jsx from Olav Kvern.

### Find Master
Go to the next page the selected master is applied to. Save preferences functionality powered by Scott Zanelli (Thank you!) Keyboard shortcut preference ctrl-M

### Fore-Edge Bleeder
Place selected files in outside margin to create a fore-edge bleed. A fore-edge bleed is similar to a [fore-edge painting](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fore-edge_painting) but in this case the image is created by printing it on the die and will become visible when the book-block is cut.

### Frame to Bleed
This script will expand or contract the selected rectangle (picture frame) to the bleed of the parent page. To fit all the frames in your document see _Document Frames to Bleed_ above.

### Frame to Margin
This script will expand or contract the selected frame (Text frame) to the margin of the parent page.

### Get DPI Based Dimensions
This script safes the actual file dimensions (in mm) of selected image files in Adobe Bridge to a text-file on given location. Just select some files in Adobe Bridge and run the script.

### Glyph Replacer
With this script you can replace the characters of a font with pictures. It is the closest thing to [Photofont](http://www.photofont.com/) we have today. The script needs a folder containing psd files (glyphs) that carry the unicode decimal number of the character it represent. For example: 65.psd would link to a Capital A. Every font folder needs at least the unicode replacement character: 65533.psd which will be used when a character is not found. When you replace characters with pictures keep in mind that the script does not know anything about hyphenation... You do however keep the ability to kern, track or change the leading.

If you are looking for decimal [codepoints](http://codepoints.net/), I love using [UnicodeChecker](http://earthlingsoft.net/UnicodeChecker/).
